item.title: Maha add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Maha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maha add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Maha add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Maha add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maha add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maha add a quote by George Eliot
item.description:
"Poor fellow! I think he is in love with you.'
I am not aware of it. And to me it is one of the most odious things in a girl's life, that there must always be some supposition of falling in love coming between her and any man who is kind to her... I have no ground for the nonsensical vanity of fancying everybody who comes near me is in love with me." -- George Eliot

item.title: Maha add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "We all know him to be a proud, unpleasant sort of man; but this would be nothing if you really liked him." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maha add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "Ah me, but where are now the songs I sang When life was sweet because you callâ€™d them sweet?" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Maha add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Maha add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Maha add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Maha add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Maha add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest." -- Confucious

item.title: Maha add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Maha add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Maha add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Maha add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: Maha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maha add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Maha add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Just remember, kid, you can quicker get back a million dollars that was stole than a word that you gave away." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Maha add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Maha add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Maha add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Maha add a quote by Nadezhda Mandelstam
item.description: "I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity." -- Nadezhda Mandelstam

item.title: Maha add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Maha add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "All serious daring starts from within." -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Maha add a quote by John Boyne
item.description: "There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them." -- John Boyne

item.title: Maha add a quote by Georgina Grey
item.description: "Just as smiles often follow tears, the sun rose full and bright on the morning.." -- Georgina Grey
